intro: Gilia tinctoria, commonly known as the Mexican redroot, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Gilia tinctoria is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
